solution.text:
Twice the rational number \(-\frac {_{j}_}{_{k}_}\) is \(-\frac {_{{2*j}}_}{_{k}_}\)
According to the question the sum of x and \(-\frac {_{{2*j}}_}{_{k}_}\) is \(\frac {_{k}_}{_{j}_}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x + \(-\frac {_{{2*j}}_}{_{k}_} = \frac {_{k}_}{_{j}_}\)

content.text:
What should be added to twice the rational number -\(\frac {_{j}_}{_{k}_}\) to get \(\frac{_{k}_}{_{j}_}\) ?
Let x be the unknown rational number, then what will be the equation ?
